fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Consumers, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, External Relations, Transport, Communication
eu_initiatives:
- Internal Market (vehicle and component type approval legislation, Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information, eCall) 
- Digital Single Market and Connectivity  
- Roadworthiness Testing 
- Competition Policy (competition law framework for the automotive aftermarket) 
- Legal Protection of Industrial Designs 
- CEN standardization work 
- Transport Policy (White Paper) 
- Environment policies (end-of life vehicles and eco-maintenance) 
- CARS 2020 Working Groups (until 2014)
organisation_name: FIGIEFA - Fédération Internationale des Grossistes, Importateurs & Exportateurs en Fournitures Automobiles / International Federation of Automotive Distributors (FIGIEFA)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Working Group on Motorcycles#E01296#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1296#Member#C#Working Group on Agricultural Tractors#E01297#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1297#Member#C#Working Group on Motor Vehicles#E01295#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=1295#Member#C#Emissions (MVEG)
membership:
FIGIEFA is member of FAIB (Federation of European and International Associations established in Belgium),as well as of UEAPME (European Association of Craft, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises).  
 
In addition, FIGIEFA is associated to ECAR (European Campaign for the Freedom of the Automotive Parts and Repair Market) and AFCAR (Alliance for the Freedom of Car Repair in the EU).  
 
FIGIEFA is currently participating in a number of fora: 
-    C-ITS Platform; 
-    CEN standardisation process on access to repair and maintenance information for passengers cars & light-duty vehicles, heavy-duty vehicles, L-category and T-category vehicles. 
 
FIGIEFA is a NGO in Roster Consultative Status with the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations.
goals__remit:
FIGIEFA represents the interests of 20 European national trade associations of automotive aftermarket distributors from 19 European countries. 
 
FIGIEFA monitors and studies EU policy developments affecting the automotive aftermarket industry value chain. Its aim is focused on the maintenance and promotion of free and effective competition in the market for vehicle replacement parts, servicing and repair.
